course.subject: IEDA
course.name: Industrial Data Systems
course.description: Fundamental concepts on database, network, object-oriented methodology, and system integration; design and development of database systems for productions (e.g. MRP), manufacturing (e.g. CAPP), and management (e.g. BPR).
course.prerequisites: COMP 1021 OR COMP 1022P OR COMP 1022Q (prior to 2020-21)
course.exclusions: COMP 3311, ISOM 3260

reviews.author: kwagor
reviews.title: Origin：Not so New Instructor
reviews.comment_content:
The switch from Qi Qi to Ajay heard to be very sudden, only a few days notice. So, Prof Ajay just pick up his 20 years old PPT back and start this course.

The content is still pretty much the same as the previous reviews entailed, unless there is a new topic of indexing in the last bit of the course.

For the lab, main focus is the PHP API of remote access to SQL database.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Very clear explanation and fast reply from TAs and Prof.

Generally speaking, ask course contents or HW obstacles to Ajay, email or in office would work, ask Lab problems to TAs Face-to-Face.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading system is as below:
Assignment 10%
Lab 15%
Individual Project 15%
Exam 1 30%
Exam 2 30%

Mean/Max:
Assignment 7.847%/10%
Lab 13.515%/15%
Project 12.24%/15%
Exam 1 17.58%/21.75%
Exam 2 17.82%/28.5%
Total 69.002%/90.25%
Ps. Bonus points 1% course mark is given to students who excelled in the project and some Lab work, as suggested by TAs.

Overall speaking the grading is quite loose-end, as indicated by scores, Exam 1 is harder, as normalisation and PHP coding is included, while Exam 2 both RA and SQL shared same logic and index is very straightforward.

For the project, the grading is somehow flexible, as long as you can demo it to the TA with the required actions is made, no need to have 100% same to the description.
reviews.comment_workload:
Exclude the Project, nearly zero workload, I spend nearly zero time in revision.

For the project, depends on how well you want to achieve, and your coding ability.

reviews.author: soy
reviews.title: Very leng grade course
reviews.comment_content:
Data base analysis (MySQL) which might be useful in your future career.
數據庫分析（MySQL）可能對您未來的職業生涯有用。
by google translate
reviews.comment_teaching:
Best professor of UST, who covers all the details in the lecture notes and extra informations. She will stay behind and answer all your questions about the notes and the HW.
UST最佳女教授，涵蓋講義和額外信息中的所有細節。 她會留下來回答你關於筆記和硬件的所有問題。
by google translate
reviews.comment_grading:
You can easily get a B+ or an A-. To get a A or A+, you will need to pay some effort.
您可以輕鬆獲得B +或A-。 要獲得A或A +，您需要付出一些努力。
by google translate
reviews.comment_workload:
Finish all the assignments by yourself to ensure that you understand the content of the lectures.
You may attend the lesson and answer at most 8 questions to get full participation marks but it does not count a lot.
自己完成所有作業，以確保您理解講座的內容。
您可以參加課程並回答最多8個問題以獲得完整的參與分數，但這並不重要。
by google translate

reviews.author: qaq3y8y982y39
reviews.title: Very Good grade
reviews.comment_content:
The course will provide an introduction to databases in the modern
industry. Three aspects will be emphasized: (a) basic Python programming techniques and the
use of Pandas package to do data analysis (b) the design of databases, including ER Models,
object oriented models, and relational data models including the theory of normalization;
building and using databases, including relational algebra, SQL, and Python Interfaced database
manipulations.
- Basic Python programming techniques
- Use Pandas to do data analysis and visualization
- Principle of relational database, including: Entity-Relationship models, functional dependencies and normalization, relational algebra, etc.
- Write and use SQL to manipulate database
- Use Python to manipulate database and conduct advanced data analysis.
- Advanced topics, e.g., non-relational database system, differential privacy.
reviews.comment_teaching: CHEN Yi is a good lecturer to save your CGA but he is not a good teacher. He fails to organize his teaching materials together to present his idea clearly.
reviews.comment_grading:
Homework (30%), midterm (30% each), and final (40%).
• Exams:
– The midterm is scheduled in the mid of semester (in lecture).
– There will be a final test as scheduled by the university.
– The exams are originally closed-book. After some students complaint, he approved us to use 4 pages doubled-sided cheatsheets.:)
- The question type of midterm exams is mostly true/false questions.

• Homeworks:
– Two types: coding homework and handwriting homework.
– Late submission can be graded but can earn at most HALF points.

I am below one sd in the mid-term exam with full-mark homework. I don't know my mark on the final exam but I think it is quite easy compared to mid-term. I finally got B+.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is light. It is ok to do the revision one week before. You can skip all the lessons and study by yourself and Google.

reviews.author: David bear
reviews.comment_content:
include basic database concepts:
Entity-Relationship models
ER diagram
Relational model
Relational Algebra
SQL
Design theory

about 8 LAB:
content includes PHP, HTML, and SQL
reviews.comment_teaching:
As our lectures and LABs are conducted online, there must be some difficulties in teaching, but Professor QI Qi did a great job I think. She explained concepts clearly, not only digital notes were displayed, but also many hand-writing notes were used in the lectures. She is approachable and you can get replies quickly if you ask questions to her or send emails to her after classes.

  TAs did a great job as well. Concepts were explained well and they could help you with Lab assignments one-on-one if you faced difficulties.
reviews.comment_grading:
4 homework(16pts)
8 labs(24pts)
midterm(25pts)
final(35pts)
bonus(4pts)

if you answer questions in the lecture, you can get a 0.5 pts bonus each lecture.

I got about one SD above the mean in minterm and almost 95 in each homework(the mean of each homework was about 85~90) and I got full marks in each lab and full bonus and the mark of final wasn't released.
I got B+ finally.
reviews.comment_workload: the workload is light. there is only 4 homework and one was released every two weeks. Each one could be done in 2~3 hours.

reviews.author: zaczeng
reviews.comment_content:
Basic Database knowledge:
Entity-Relationship models
ER diagram
Relational Algebra
SQL

Easy content, even for student without computer backgroud.
What you learned from this course may not be used in the future, you should put more attention on learning python. The course aims to build a fundemental logic of designing a data system and engineer thinking. No need to worry about diffcult or complicated content.
reviews.comment_teaching: QI QI is a patient and  responsible instructor. She is willing to answer student's questions on or after class. However her speaking speed is lower than normal speed.
reviews.comment_grading:
Homework(12pts): Five homework, HW1-4 will be graded, each 3pts.

Labs(18pts):Nine labs, each worth 2 points (1pt attendance, 1pt performance)  

Midterm(30pts)

Final(40pts)

Bonus(4pts):0.5pt for answering questions in one of the lectures. Maximum 4pts for the whole semester
reviews.comment_workload:
Pay attention on the class and ask question more acttively. Do homework by your self, throgh that you can complete the
lack of knowledge. The diffculty of homework is ok, can be done in 2 hours. I pay more attention on the class and nearly not study after class, at last I got an A.

reviews.author: otkm
reviews.title: good grade

-index

project (not easy)
you should spend more time to finish it
Lab every week

exam are not difficult if you do homework seriously

the content of two exam will not overlap

they teach very well
good explanation in lecture and clear step to follow in lab

grading is good

Lab
project (full marks)

workload is quite low, 5 hw, exam1, project (about SQL and php), final (exam2)
homeworks are easy
